name: Hued Vase: Dark Rock
description: Porcelain jars that are normally seen in Deshret Desert. The main part presents a deep "dark rock color," which is the product of the latest generation of desert pottery craft. The outer protective shell is said to be strong enough to withstand a blow from a hammer, and the jar protected by it would not shatter even if it fell from a high place. It is as strong as rock indeed, and therefore is ideal for storing things of value.\nSome sellswords, however, went in the opposite direction, trying to place a protective shell inside a clay flask filled with explosives, using its ruggedness to create a lot of shrapnel and build a more potent explosive barrel. But due to high costs, they ultimately decided against it.
